Description: The HREDA archive collects the results of ESA fund…atforms and microgravity ground-based facilities.

Description: The ISS Publication ARChive (ISPARC) database coll…paration of space experiment, starting from 2014.

Description: Data ARchives and Transmission System (DARTS) is a… and planetary science, and microgravity science.

Description: This site provides archives of JAXA investigations…ll JAXA’s activities relating to the ISS program.

Name: International Space Station ROSCOSMOS Educational Activity

Name: Cloudspotting on Mars
Description: Solar System project that can be done by anyone, anywhere, with a cellphone or laptop.

Name: Dark Energy Explorers
Description: Identify distant galaxies to help measure dark energy when the universe was just ~2-3 billion years old

Name: Planet Hunter TESS
Description: Join the Search for Undiscovered Worlds

Name: Exoplanet Watch
Description: Get involved in exoplanet research!

Name: NeMO-Net
Description: Help classify corals using your iPad

Name: Are we alone in the universe?
Description: Join the search for extraterrestrial civilizations!

Name: Aurorasaurus
Description: Report aurora sightings

Name: Planet Patrol
Description: Help find out which planet candidates from the TESS mission are real!

Name: Disk Detective
Description: Spot the disks around nearby stars where planets form and dwell!

Name: Solar Active Region Spotter
Description: Help track active regions as they evolve across solar rotations!

Name: GLOBE Observer: Clouds, Land Cover, Mosquito Habitats
Description: Help monitor the conditions of clouds, water (especially as a habitat for mosquitoes), plants (trees and other land cover), and see change over time.

Name: Heliophysics Audified: Resonances in Plasmas
Description: Join the HARP Citizen Science team and engage in cutting edge research of real satellite data!

Name: Backyard Worlds: Planet 9
Description: Search the realm beyond Neptune for new brown dwarfs and planets.

Name: Active Asteroids
Description: Examine images to find comet-like tails... on asteroids! These strange objects hold clues about water on Earth, in the solar system, and beyond.

Name: Daily Minor Planet
Description: Discover new asteroids every day!

Name: Landslide Reporter
Description: Together, we can build a clearer picture of landslides.

Name: Floating Forests
Description: Discover floating forests

Name: Solar Jet Hunter
Description: Join the hunt for solar jets — enigmatic bursts of energy from our own star — the Sun!

Name: Mapping Application for Penguin Populations and Projected Dynamics
Description: Help map penguin populations!

Name: Fresh Eyes on Ice
Description: Connecting Arctic Communities through a Revitalized and Modernized Freshwater Ice Observation Network

Name: Sungrazer Project
Description: The Sungrazer Project is a NASA-funded program than enables the discovery and reporting of previously unknown comets in the ESA/NASA SOHO and NASA STEREO satellite instrument fields of view.

Name: Jovian Vortex Hunter
Description: Help us find interesting features in Jupiter's atmosphere!

Name: Lake Observations by Citizen Scientists and Satellites
Description: The Lake Observations by Citizen Scientists & Satellites project seeks to better understand how the quantity of water in lakes is changing.

Name: UNITE
Description: Use your telescope to confirm the existence of newly discovered worlds

Name: Chesapeake Water Watch
Description: Help our scientists collect water quality data in the Chesapeake Bay!

Name: Growing Beyond Earth
Description: Growing Beyond Earth® (GBE) is a classroom-based citizen science project operated in partnership with NASA

Name: Mountain Rain or Snow
Description: During winter storms, tell us what is falling from the sky.

Name: HamSCI
Description: Advance scientific research and understanding through amateur radio activities.

Name: JunoCam
Description: We’re calling all amateur astronomers to upload their telescopic images and data of Jupiter.

Name: Fjord Phyto
Description: Understanding polar fjords through community effort

Name: International Astronomical Search Collaboration
Description: The International Astronomical Search Collaboration (IASC) is a citizen science program that provides high-quality astronomical data to citizen scientists around the world. These citizen scientists are able to make original astronomical discoveries and participate in hands-on astronomy.

Name: Community Snow Observations
Description: Make your backcountry travels count! We need your help measuring snow depths in mountain places too vast for researchers to monitor. But we also want to know the snow depth near urban areas - anytime, anywhere is our motto.

Name: Soundscapes to Landscapes
Description: Soundscapes to Landscapes (S2L) is a science-based project that seeks to advance animal biodiversity monitoring by making use of Earth-observing satellites. The project is currently focused on mapping bird diversity across Sonoma County, California, but could expand to other animal groups and landscapes in the future.

Name: Redshift Wrangler
Description: Help us use the light from distant galaxies to look back in time to the early universe!

Name: Cool Neighbors
Description: Searching for brown dwarfs, cool neighbors of our Sun.

Name: Radio JOVE
Description: Radio JOVE students and amateur scientists from around the world observe and analyze natural radio emissions of Jupiter, the Sun, and our galaxy using their own easy to construct radio telescopes.

Name: MoonDiff
Description: MoonDiff serves up 'before-and-after' pictures of the Moon taken from two orbiting spacecraft: one that visited the moon in 1967, and one that arrived in 2009 and is still flying. Volunteers are invited to compare those pictures to discover the differences. Their discoveries teach us about the Moon's dynamic surface, and contribute to lunar exploration.

Name: Eclipse Soundscapes
Description: The Eclipse Soundscapes Project is a NASA Citizen Science project funded by NASA Science Activation that is studying how eclipses affect life on Earth during the October 14, 2023 annular solar eclipse and the April 8, 2024 total solar eclipse. Eclipse Soundscapes will revisit an eclipse study from almost 100 years ago that showed that animals and insects are affected by solar eclipses! Like this study from 100 years ago, ES will ask for the public’s help. ES will also use modern technology to continue to study how solar eclipses affect life on Earth!

Name: Eclipse Megamovie
Description: Returning for the April 2024 total solar eclipse to study the sun’s atmosphere (the corona) in white light to better understand the density of the changing plasma in the sun’s atmosphere.
